location.merchant_description_html: Recently, I’ve somehow earned the reputation of being deranged. The truth of the matter is that I just get a little carried away when I catch the garlic-y scent of smooth Hummus as I enter Mediterranean Grill. I hear them whisper. “Look at how she strokes her Pita. She’s about as nutty as the Walnut Baklava.” But when I sink my teeth into a warm Shish Kabob Wrap, packed with lean cuts of marinated tenderloin, crisp lettuce and a lavish layer of tahini, my system goes into overdrive. Some people leave in a hurry when I start talking to myself, leaving behind their precious Gyros. Welp, more for me.

Never have I ever: eaten a wrap with a fork... until today. My fingers couldn’t handle the workout at The Berliner. Their döner wrap is so astoundingly large, I quivered under the weight. I ordered the Fiery Kreuzberg with lamb, slapped with a punch of chili yogurt sauce, set off by banana peppers, and piled with fixings like fresh cilantro and red cabbage. I wrestled between the spinach wrap and pita, but my heart landed on the Fladenbrot, a Turkish-German style flatbread. I picked up my fork to finish it off. My muscles will need a break, so tomorrow it’s the Feta Chicken Salad, for sure.

Never have I ever: eaten a wrap with a fork... until today. My fingers couldn’t handle the workout at The Berliner. Their döner wrap is so astoundingly large, I quivered under the weight. I ordered the Fiery Kreuzberg with lamb, slapped with a punch of chili yogurt sauce, set off by banana peppers, and piled with fixings like fresh cilantro and red cabbage. I wrestled between the spinach wrap and pita, but my heart landed on the Fladenbrot, a Turkish-German style flatbread. I picked up my fork to finish it off. My muscles will need a break, so tomorrow it’s the Feta Chicken Salad, for sure.

Espressit Coffee is a neighborhood destination for strong brews and sought-after baked goods. Case in point: I was in the shop for my daily La Columbe coffee when a tray of vegan Chocolate Avocado Muffins emerged from the oven. What is the appropriate response? My initial reaction would have been to hijack the counter, using my purse as an oven mitt to secure the warm delights. Seeing as I like this place A LOT, I decided that a more poised approach would be better. A stern “gimme dat?” Too direct. A puppy-eyed glance? Oh, pull yourself together woman. “Those look delicious! Could I get one of them?” The barista smiled and into a bag went my muffin. Victory.

Meat-eaters and meat-haters, it is time to embrace in perfect harmony. Craving Grilled Beef Tenderloin with arugula, tomatoes and crumbled blue cheese? What about vegetarian Caribbean Butternut Squash soup? Well, you've come to the same place. Regardless of whether you're a strict vegan or die-hard carnivore, the only thing that matters to MetroFresh is serving healthy, nutritious meals in a friendly environment. With a rotating daily menu and an eager staff, the real question is: sit inside or out?

When it comes to Yogurt, I prefer it on the Rocks. With 28 flavors, 36 toppings, 10 sweet sauces and a rainbow of fresh fruit, there are plenty of chill options. Take my favorite self-serve creation: first, I swirl a frozen layer of Cake Batter, decked with rounds of Cookie Dough and Chocolate drops. I top that with a mountain of Pumpkin, littered with red blasts of Strawberry and an avalanche of Coconut. All of the young yogurt-lickers stare. It’s taboo to mix non-complementary flavors. I put on my shades and strut to the outdoor patio. I live my life on the edge, and take my Yogurt on the Rocks.

Hey Chelsea, there’s a cornucopia of lunch options waiting at Buccieri’s Pizzeria! They’re known for their made-to-order subs, homemade soups, and enormous salads. Sounds pretty simple...so...what’s their secret? They crank out hot, crispy, fresh baked bread on the regular! You’ll start any sandwich off right with a plank of homemade wheat or white. Start your BC allegiance with a loaded Hanover Street (an Italian stacker consisting of prosciutto, roasted peppers and sharp provolone) or an addictive Chicken Salad sammy!

I consider this a magnificent work of art. I murmur a few “Mmms” and stroke my chin (very necessary to assert intelligence.) I point out the delicate contrast of white and illustrious red to a passerby... the Caprese Salad deserves an audience. When my Lobster Ravioli arrives, I marvel at the freshness and rosy tomato cream sauce. As I savor my last bite, a roar erupts outside. I look in time to see the stream of black & gold jerseys pass by. Ah, game time. I dab the corners of my mouth, smear on face paint using a spoon as a mirror. Fueled up on Cafe Rustico, I head to the Garden for the Bruins battle!

Maria! Andiamo! Let’s go! Time for lunch. We’re going to Trattoria Andiamo so ya motha can have a rest for once. They do everything so fresh and authentic over there. Heck, I’d even invite them over for dinner with their creamy Mac & Cheese and that fresh Baked Haddock. And oh, the bread! Iggy’s baguettes, warm focaccia. I’m tellin’ ya the Tuscany Panini is the best. Tender rosemary chicken, smothered in pesto mayo with balsamic and herbs. Open 20 years and they’ve still got it! Those Italian genes...

Salon on 4th’s motto is “Be Yourself.” And why shouldn’t you? They enhance what you’re already working with. An arch of the eyebrow or Framesi Italian HairColor will have you ready to hit the streets of Fabric Row. The stylists are certified specialists in Yuko Japanese Straightening. This technique is proven to restore and straighten your hair! Split ends are history, and a fabulous night out is in your future. Last step: the music video test. Flip it, J-Lo it, Beyonce bounce, whatever you gotta do. Your cut will look just as sexy as when you stepped out of your chair. #CelebrityStatus.

I’ve discovered my love for the Smoked Ham Sandwich. Here’s why: The grill has branded it with delicious crispy stripes. You can see the monterey jack oozing out of the sides over the thick slabs of ham. Roma tomatoes brush against the mayo and honey mustard creating a smashing flavor. #TheNewPickle

Do. Not. Fear. Seitan. I know how it sounds…but trust me. Or taste for yourself at the bustling Chicago Diner, which has been dishing veg & vegan comfort food since 1983. Get your deli on with a famous Radical Reuben, or bite a Titanic BLT Burger topped with BBQ mayo & French fried onions. Not quite ready to enter the faux meat zone? Chill with a Soul Bowl of quinoa, spicy tofu, sweet potatoes and black beans, or Thai Chili Wingz. I promise you, the only faith-challenging seitan might do is induce a Country Fried “Steak” fever.

Coffee is more than a pick-me-up at the crack of dawn. It's a personal connection, brewed hot and tailored to your morning preference. At My Coffee Shop, features organic, fair trade, Georgia-roasted coffees. Each sip puts a little pep in your step and helps local farmers. Want to stay and rest for a while? They also serve made-to-order sandwiches, fresh pastries and smoothies. Take a seat on the shiny red couch and savor a fresh Turkey Sandwich, hugged by whole wheat bread. Enjoy, refresh and give back to the community. What's in YOUR coffee?

I stroll into Ike’s Place in the Forbes Family Cafe at Stanford and head to the counter. “What in the world is the ‘Name of the Girl I’m Dating?’” I hear a gasp, then see my girlfriend. “Flirting with the counter girl!?” she screeches. I explain that it’s the name of a sandwich, stacked with halal chicken, avocado and pepper jack. She wails. Counter-girl steps in and hands me a stacked sandwich. This chicken rendezvous is thrice-saucy (honey, honey mustard and BBQ) and thrice-cheesy (p. jack, gouda and Swiss.) I offer it to my GF. “How about a Menage et Trois? You’d like that, right?” Cue waterworks.

Unique in many ways, Rock House has a world class rock and roll music school for all ages. On the main floor is Rock House Coffee Bar, Roasting Company and live music venue featuring great musicians and bands every Friday and Saturday night.

Whether it's your morning commute, afternoon lunch, or after dinner spot, we will rock you. We also offer an eclectic mix of retail items ranging from musical instruments to jewelry, vinyl, and t shirts.

Rock House is a place to Rock. And a place to Roll.

You’re not labeled a hipster when you choose to buy local, organic foods from humane and sustainable farms. Anyone can do the locavore dance. It’s simply about caring about your body, your world and the farmers who are dedicated to bringing you the juiciest peaches. The Fair Food stand in Reading Terminal Market is a no-brainer. Taste samples of creamy brie wedges and revel in rainbows of red peppers and green apples!

At Iovine Brothers Urban Produce, the magic is in the details. Even above the hustle and bustle of Reading Terminal Market, the world grows quiet for a single sound: SNAP. The crisp cut of teeth breaking through a glowing, locally-grown apple. The opening crack of a package of Dried Apricots, sweet like candy (but healthier!) Here, the workers are “Produce Guides.” They use their extensive product knowledge to steer shoppers towards delicious and nutritious decisions. You can’t beat extraordinary produce at the most incredible prices in Philly. Iovine makes getting your health fix a snap!

Coming to you live from Huntington Avenue, this is a hot, new jam from Green T Coffee! “Wake up in the morning, feeling not-so-pretty. Grab my glasses I’m out the door I’m gonna hit this city. Grab the T when I leave, straight to my Fenway Road shack. Destination: Green T Coffee, yo I always come back. I’m talking exposed brick on my walls, walls. Fresh brewed coffees nice and tall, tall. Baristas warmin’ up my favorite meal, meal. Egg-toppin’ bagels and cream cheese, please. Pulling up to my office, trying to get a little Cafen-ayyy-ted.”

You can work up a serious appetite while exploring the Discovery Museum. Luckily J-Dogs Cafe is on-premises to provide a carnival of kid-friendly lunch options. Little ones favor the “Kids Meal” flavors: crispy nuggets, juicy hot dogs and PB&J (all served with juice boxes and a sweet snack!) As for you chaperones, you’ll have the kids saying “I want to eat THAT when I get older” as they eye your loaded Chicken Quesadilla. There are even pizza party options for large groups. Store that gem in your “Birthday Survival” file. “Excuse me, Lord Dribble Chin? You must wipe that purple Slush Puppy trail off of your face before we get back to the exhibits.”

I’m going to Church every night this week. No, not that kind. I’m going to Sister Louisa’s Church of the Living Room & Ping Pong Emporium. I’ll sing Cher’s gospel in a choir robe at Church Organ Karaoke. I pray for a stroke of talent in the Monday night ping-pong tournament. I’ll sip Spiritual Sangria made by the hands of Sister Louisa herself (aka owner/epic bartender Grant Henry.) If I feel I’ve had one glass too many, I’ll seek aid in the portraits of spiritual experts (MLK, Jesus, Elvis), then head to the 1800s-era confessional-turned-photo-booth, where my sins will dissolve with the camera flash. Amen.
location.merchant_name: Sister Louisa's Church of the Living Room

location.merchant_description_html: Some people are spooked by pre-packaged meals. I, personally want them to believe the evil plastic hype simply because that means more gourmet to-go for me at Fleur de Sel. Restaurant-caliber gnocchi. Summer BBQ-worthy short ribs. Savory smoked salmon ceviche. Sandwiches that test the vertical limit! Each pefect portion is labeled with instructions and nutritional facts. It’s like an adult version of a mom-packed lunch...if your mom cooks with the flare and fancy of a Top Chef contender.

France! Get your nose out of the flippin’ air. You’re not the only one who can make a soul-satisfying crepe. In fact, I’d go as far as saying that you should be threatened by the globally inclusive crepes at Crepan Crepe World. Korea is owning the savory scene hard with a spicy Korean BBQ chicken crepe, topped with a boiled egg, cabbage and mayo. Even the US of A is in the game with a cheese-covered hot dog, topped with lettuce, tomato and ketch. And Canadian bacon and pineapple, ay? Parisians, you may have the city of lights, but CCW’s got crepe delights.

Keg & Kitchen is new, BRAND NEW. Sandwiched between the dry cities of Haddonfield and Collingswood, the “keg” in Keg & Kitchen is an alcohol oasis with 17 local and Belgian beers on tap and another 100 varieties in bottles. The “kitchen” in Keg & Kitchen reflects the craft food that perfectly compliments the craft beer. Think comfort food favorites with a gourmet twist: a meatball sub transformed into sliders of the duck, beef and pork varieties. Though the restaurant has changed a lot in terms of decor and menu, it carries over the old, reliable quality of its predecessor, Cork.

I like my coffee with a dash of sugar and a lot of personality, so my choice for best morning cup goes to Freshy’s Coffee. I order a sweet and creamy Caramel Latte and scan today’s souper soups. Ah, the Braised Pork, spiced with chipotle peppers... sold. As I sit, a vintage gem catches my eye: a Ms. Pac Man game, practically begging for me to tousle her joystick and gobble ghosts. Soon, my soup and drink emerge, one sweet, one spicy, both steaming. Freshy’s mugs are like snowflakes... no two are alike! Today, mine is of the Batman variety. In a world where hundreds of coffee shops are alike, this one keeps it fresh ‘n funky.

The perfect amount of spooning is often debated among couples. Before you start shrieking about cuddle failures in tones that only dolphins can hear, let us weigh in on a different kind of spooning...literally. Spoon Me is a weigh and pay, self-serve frozen yogurt shop in Voorhees Township. Spooning some Extreme Cookies ‘n Cream is well, err...satisfying! And toppings? Make it rain with brownie bits, granola, candy or fresh fruit. Since the yogurt itself is fat free and packed with active cultures, vitamins and minerals...you deserve a little something sweet on the top. They’ve also got fresh-pressed juice and hot-off-the-griddle waffles! So, quit forking around and cruise over to Spoon Me for your next date night.

In recent studies, it’s been shown that happiness falls in direct correlation with the number of times one eats at Brazilian Bowl. The best bowl builders know the secrets to a good hunt. Start with a satisfying protein: pork loin, tomato-braised angus or Brazilian sausage. After that, the food carnival really begins with freshly sliced veggies and loads of rice. On the side, cop a sunshiney pineapple-mango’d Rio Smoothie. We see people really go off the happiness deep end after the Bolo Prestigo, a chocolate cake littered with coconut. We’ve gotta say... it’s a delicious epidemic.

From where I stand at the counter, I’ve got the perfect view of the show. My eyes train on the ⅓ pound burger, flipping mid-air. Smoky grill marks reveal themselves with each rotation. Gravity pulls the beef back down to its branding iron, and an open flame leaps up to warm the burger where it can. Beside it, a Nathan’s Hot Dog sweats on the grill, before being nestled into its huggin’ bun. Here comes the chili, coating the open face of the dog before it’s slathered in cheese. Burger and Dog in hand, I find a table in the Prudential Food Court. Soon, I’m surrounded by a hungry hoard of shoppers, sniffing wildly. “Flamers is that way guys... go fetch!”
Uh-oh seems like we haven't reviewed this place yet!

After moonlighting as last night’s drunken special, I drag myself to work. As I walk, I spot a sign pointing to a walkway promising juice and sandwiches. I follow the secret passage to City Kinetics. While I wait for my Sausage & Egg Breakfast Burrito, I poke around. Tamales, donuts and falafel sent my mind spinning. Wait... I know where I am. I found Hangover Heaven! One bite of my Burrito, and I’m 100% sure. As I leave, the owner calls out, “Have a great day, beautiful!” I whip around, chipmunk cheeks full of eggs, bewildered. He waves. Burritos, a staff of angels and flattery? I’ll be back.

My beautiful dark twisted fantasy: A muted closed captioned orca whale documentary on TV, with the smooth stylings of Salt-n-Pepa emanating from the jukebox; the thunderous crash of breaking pool balls and satisfying thumps of darts hitting the center target. A disco ball splashes light on the faces that fill the booths, including those of me and my peeps as we indulge in cocktails and snack on pizza, popcorn and corn dogs. The best part of this fantasy? It exists. Find me at Quarter Lounge on Trivia Tuesday.
